numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I noticed a difference between a legacy person and a non-legacy person.
2. This difference is huge for upper-middle-class people.
3. For an upper-middle-class person, it is hardest to get admitted without legacy status.
4. For a super-wealthy person, the acceptance chance is much higher than for an upper-middle-class person.
5. For a super-wealthy person, the acceptance chance is high regardless of legacy status.
6. For a super-wealthy person, the acceptance chance is significantly higher if the person has legacy status.
7. Politicians are concerned with an unfair advantage that affirmative action gave.
8. Politicians conveniently overlook legacy acceptances.
9. Some people say that we should reward people based on hard work.
10. Some people say that we should not reward people based on luck of the draw.
11. This argument was used in the past summer.
12. In the past summer, affirmative action was overturned.
13. Some people say that being a person of color is luck of the draw.
14. Many legacy persons are white.
15. Many legacy persons are wealthy.
16. Legacy acceptances may uphold systemic inequality.
17. I know many legacy students.
18. I know many students who were admitted into a top-20 university on merit.
19. I know many students who were admitted into an Ivy League university on merit.
20. Most legacy students that I know are white.
21. Most legacy students that I know are privileged.
22. Most legacy students that I know are relatively less accomplished than non-legacy students that I know.
23. I do not say that legacy students are not smart.
24. I do not say that legacy students are not talented.
25. There is a clear favor toward legacy students.
26. The headline is: Lucky in Legacy: An Ivy's four leaf clover.
